item.title: Docker
item.description: Set up Docker environment Images and containers An image is an executable package that includes everything needed to run an application–the code, a runtime, libraries, environment variables, and configuration files. A container is a runtime instance of an image–what the image becomes in memory when executed. A container runs natively on Linux and shares the kernel of the host machine with other containers. Install Docker add your user to the docker group.
